metadata.title: CVE-2018-13305 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In FFmpeg 4.0.1, due to a missing check for negative values of the mquantvariable, the vc1_put_blocks_clamped function in libavcodec/vc1_block.c maytrigger an out-of-array access while converting a crafted AVI file toMPEG4, leading to an information disclosure or a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.1-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.1-1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.1-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.1-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.1-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.1-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.1-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.1-1').
mythtv package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
gst-libav1.0 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
